independent political entity
Energy - policy, planning and administration

1a. Russian language resource materials on HCFC control options prepared 1b. Awareness training for decision-makers on legislative and regulatory actions accomplished 1c. Regional networking on the country in the region is supported 2a. Russian language resource documentation 2b. Awareness raising activities 2c. Regional networking 3a. Training of Trainers (enforcement) 3b. Training of Trainers (refrigeration) 3c. Participation in the informal Prior Informed Consent Network 4. Preparation of Russian language training manuals and information materials 5a. Regional networking 5b. Participation in the informal Prior Informed Consent Network 6a. Promotion of Information exchange mechanisms 6b. Facilitation of regional dialogue 6c. Preparation of Russian language information materials

comment.narrative: 1. Key stakeholders generally have limited awareness of the issue or actions required on the higher or technical level to address HCFC phase-out; 2. Decision-makers from enforcement department (Environment Protection, Customs) have limited knowledge and lack practical skills on the regulatory approaches to effectively control HCFC related challenges 3. Limited number or lack of trained trainers on enforcement and best refrigeration aspects 4. Required materials in Russian or local languages, on HCFC control options, Customs enforcement approaches and methodologies, refrigeration sector capacity building, energy-efficiency, alternative technologies and their application, illegal trade and PIC, technician certification and ODS waste management related issues are limited in availability or absent 5. Regional networking with other partner countries in the region is lacking which prevents information and experience exchange 6. Cooperation between non-Article 5 countries on effective action standards is minimal or absent

• Project meeting and Project Board Meeting organized • Project Manager (50%) recruited, on board and trained • Key document of Customs Training manual translated into Russian • Other adapted documents developed in 2014 translated, laid out and published electronically • Two (2) missions conducted by the International Consultant on HCFC legislation and customs to Uzbekistan and One (1) in Ukraine • Road-map on HCFC legislation developed for tracking progress in four (4) countries in an harmonised manner • Joint regional Training of Trainers organized for refrigeration technician specialists from all four participating countries and certification obtained by all technicians as an outcome of the training • Four (4) delegations to participate in the Regional ozone network meetings organized by UNEP for Europe and Central Asia in Armenia • Four (4) delegations to participate in the Thematic meeting on HPMPs in October 2015 • Awareness-raising of policymakers conducted through targeted missions of the international consultant on HCFC legislation, in support of the activities conducted by the national teams on a daily basis with partner ministries • International expert retained on ODS disposal in the participating countries • One specific publication on RAC developed for the region and specifically the four participating countries

• Project meeting and Project Board Meeting organized • Project Manager (50%) recruited and started working as of October 2015 • Two (2) missions conducted by the International Consultant on HCFC legislation and customs to Uzbekistan and One (1) in Ukraine • Road-map on HCFC legislation developed for tracking progress in four (4) countries in an harmonised manner • Joint regional Training of Trainers for fourteen (14) refrigeration technician specialists from all four participating countries successfully completed with all participants receiving EU certification in September 2015 • Four (4) delegations participated in the Regional ozone network meetings organized by UNEP for Europe and Central Asia in Armenia • Four (4) delegations participated in the Thematic meeting on HPMPs in October 2015 • Awareness-raising of policymakers conducted through targeted missions of the international consultant on HCFC legislation, in support of the activities conducted by the national teams on a daily basis with partner ministries

description.narrative: The project will: a) support corporate strategic partnerships with Russia and Turkey; b) promote east-east cooperation linkages; c) support innovative models and delivery mechanisms in ODA.
The New ODA Cooperation Partnership with Romania (2013-2015)
independent political entity

comment.narrative: Romania has an ODA legal framework in place with sectorial priorities and geographical areas already established. Nevertheless, Romania should also develop a clear vision on its substantive contribution to global development cooperation and clear niches to position itself on the development cooperation space. 1. No high-profile event on key policy topics has been hosted by Romania during the last 5 years 2. Low number of theme-, region- or country- focused reports/policy papers developed by Romania 3. No communication and visibility strategy in place 4. Limited ODA management capacity and lack of specialized human resources in the field 5. No Mobility Fund or similar rapid response financing instrument has been used before 6. Recent experience demonstrated that Romania, as other new European Union (EU) member countries, has a unique service offering for developing countries on the paths of democratic and market reform to countries in Eastern Europe, North Africa and the Middle East. Few similar events already implemented by the Country Office.
